issues.description: The problem statement’s UML and text specify acceptSupplyDelivery(String supplierName, String ingredientName, int price, int quantity), but both the sample code in Main.java and the solution’s SealSaloon implementation define acceptSupplyDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity) (three parameters). This mismatch will confuse students about the correct method signature and cause tests based on the problem spec to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the signature across all artifacts. Either remove the supplierName parameter from the problem statement UML/text or add the supplierName parameter to the solution (and update sample calls) so that acceptSupplyDelivery consistently has four parameters: String supplierName, String ingredientName, int price, int quantity.
